    • Constructor Detail

      • OrdXYErrData

        public OrdXYErrData​(int serial,
                    X x,
                    Y y,
                    XErr xError,
                    YErr yError,
                    boolean SD,
                    int NoofPoints)
        Parameters:
        serial - : Serial number of the data point. Can be used to restore the order of data points to the input after sorting. for instance one might sort on y values then and perform the desired operation on the data set and then sort on serial number to restore to the input order.
        x - : x value it can be any of data type sub classed from Number
        y - : y value it can be any of data type sub classed from Number
        xError - : value of error in x axis typically it is either standard deviation or standard error. Data type is one of the sub classes of Number
        yError - : value of error in x axis typically it is either standard deviation or standard error. Data type is one of the sub classes of Number
        SD - : Boolean for if the error bar is SD (True). False would mean the error bar is SEM
        NoofPoints - : Number of data points used to arrive at the SD or SE for this particular point. It is assumed that number of points averaged to arrive at error bar is same for X and Y.

      • OrdXYErrData

        public OrdXYErrData​(int serial,
                    X x,
                    Y y)

      • isIsSD

        public boolean isIsSD()
        Checks for the flag setting to determine if the error bar is standard deviation Note: This flag needs to be set by the user during the data input stage.
        Returns:
        the isSD

      • setIsSD

        public void setIsSD​(boolean isSD)
        Set the flag to determine if the error bar in the present in this data is standard deviation(true) or standard error(false).
        Parameters:
        isSD - the isSD to set

      • getifSD

        public boolean getifSD()
        Returns:
        true if the error bar is SD false if SEM (This is set by the user at the time of initialization.

      • setifSD

        public boolean setifSD​(boolean SD)
        Parameters:
        SD - call it with True to interpret the error bar at SD False for interpreting it as SEM. This is assumed to be same for Y and X error bar. Note : It is not calculated by the class or any members of this class (You can not do that as all you have is 'a' value for X, 'a' value for Y.
        Returns:

      • getNumberofPoints

        public int getNumberofPoints()
        Use this function to get the number points that is used to average and get the X and Y mean and error bar associated with it. Use the return value to calculate SEM from SD or vice versa.
        Returns:

      • setNumberofPoints

        public void setNumberofPoints​(int noPoints)
        Use this function to set the number points that is used to average and get the X and Y mean and error bar associated with it.
        Parameters:
        npPoints - : number of points over which the error bar is calculated. Provided to go from SD to SEM and vice versa.
